---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>
Date: Sun, Apr 22, 2012 at 2:14 PM
Subject: RE: Roadrunner extract
To: Domenico Ventura <Domenico.Ventura@deltatre.com>, Kieran Topping
<kieran@kitsite.com>, Richard Caelius <richard@xomodigital.com>
Cc: Steve Wiseall <Steve.Wiseall@london2012.com>, Tom Price-Stephens
<Tom.Price-Stephens@london2012.com>, Morag Reavley
<Morag.Reavley@london2012.com>


Hi All,



Please find attached an updated TB file. Only change in this one is to
change community name ‘Cleehill’ from Roadrunner to ‘Clee Hill’ which
is the name we published and appears to be what both the GTW and the
current website expect. (According to Wikipedia either spelling is
correct!)



Could we get this processed to sites and apps please.



Guidance on how we’ll handle the ‘moments’ is still pending. I’ll
chase the torch team when they are back in the office tomorrow.



Thanks,

Andy



From: Andy Watkins
Sent: 20 April 2012 11:41
To: 'Domenico Ventura'; Tom Price-Stephens; 'Kieran Topping'
Cc: Steve Wiseall; Kavita Kapoor; Jamie Unwin
Subject: RE: Roadrunner extract



Hi Domenico,



Well, this has been a fun one to investigate! My findings as follows.



1. Ballygalley and Malborough are misspelt communities in Roadrunner.
Not sure how we’ve not spotted them before, but I’ve corrected in our
macro so the updated extract attached should have the correct values
of Ballygally and Marlborough. Similarly, I’ve changed Nottingham (a)
to just Nottingham.



2. Denham and Shaldon are genuine communities but missing from the
Regions mapping. Denham needs to be added to London, and Shaldon needs
to be added to the South West.



3. The others are all ‘moments’, which are generally short diversions
to take in a famous place or landmark. In the rush to get the last
release out we agreed these would not be accessible via the
region/communities search (they still appear in searches by name and
date), but we’ll need to address this on the GTW. We’ll either assign
them to the nearest actual community, using the macro, or include them
in the communities list. I’ll confirm as soon as I can but I think the
latter option is probably the more palatable.



Kieran, could you apply the change in point 2 to the current TB search
page, and process the updated extract attached?



Steve, I’ve converted Kieran’s json file containing the communities to
regions mapping into a spreadsheet, attached. You might find this
useful for testing.



Thanks all,

Andy



From: Domenico Ventura [mailto:Domenico.Ventura@deltatre.com]
Sent: 19 April 2012 19:11
To: Tom Price-Stephens; Andy Watkins
Cc: Steve Wiseall; Kavita Kapoor
Subject: RE: Roadrunner extract



Hi guys,



I’d like to get some clearings (hopefully final) on the format of the
torch bearers export.

In the task Kavita stated it was going to be an .xls

Then got form Andy that it would be a csv, but with tab instead of
commas as delimiters,

Then now this one is a CSV, with actually commas as delimiters



In this last export, there are around 75 bearers running tru a
community which is not present in the latest list of communities by
region got yesterday. This is the list of communities that do not
match:



Aintree

Ballarena

Ballygalley

Brands Hatch

Cleehill

Denham

Duxford Airport

Fountains Abbey

Hasswell Plough

Kimmel Bay

Knowsley Safari Park

Llanrhystyd

Malborough

Malty Le Marsh

Moorfield

New Scone

North Ballachulish

Nottingham (a)

Raydon

Ridingmill

Samphire Hoe

Sandringham Estate

Shaldon

Stormont Castle





Ciao domenico



From: Tom Price-Stephens [mailto:Tom.Price-Stephens@london2012.com]
Sent: giovedì 19 aprile 2012 19:37
To: Steve Wiseall; Domenico Ventura
Subject: Roadrunner extract



Sorry chaps,

Was meant to send this last night, the most recent Roadrunner extract
that was sent yesterday.

Shout if you have any questions,

Thanks,

Tom

Hi Domenico,



Well, this has been a fun one to investigate! My findings as follows.



1. Ballygalley and Malborough are misspelt communities in Roadrunner.
Not sure how we’ve not spotted them before, but I’ve corrected in our
macro so the updated extract attached should have the correct values
of Ballygally and Marlborough. Similarly, I’ve changed Nottingham (a)
to just Nottingham.



2. Denham and Shaldon are genuine communities but missing from the
Regions mapping. Denham needs to be added to London, and Shaldon needs
to be added to the South West.



3. The others are all ‘moments’, which are generally short diversions
to take in a famous place or landmark. In the rush to get the last
release out we agreed these would not be accessible via the
region/communities search (they still appear in searches by name and
date), but we’ll need to address this on the GTW. We’ll either assign
them to the nearest actual community, using the macro, or include them
in the communities list. I’ll confirm as soon as I can but I think the
latter option is probably the more palatable.



Kieran, could you apply the change in point 2 to the current TB search
page, and process the updated extract attached?



Steve, I’ve converted Kieran’s json file containing the communities to
regions mapping into a spreadsheet, attached. You might find this
useful for testing.



Thanks all,

Andy

Hi,
As you know we are making changes on Akamai to cache 301,302 and 404 pages for 1 min and if Akamai receive 500 then it will switch over to netstorage,
Because this rely on communication between origin and Akamai edge server, we need to upload following scripts on temporary location for london2012.com
Can you create two PHP files with following codes.
Following code will response with 404 but with additional response header field with timestamp

Test404.php
<?PHP
date_default_timezone_set('UTC');
header('HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found');
header('temp: '.date('g:i:s'));
?>

Next simple code is to trigger 500 response code

Failovertest.php
<?PHP
header("Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate");
header('HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error');
?>

Please contact me if you have any question
Thanks
Sharique

Test500 will not switch entire site to Netstorage, at a moment configuration is live on Akamai staging so live site is out of scope, Idea here is to make a request to Akamai staging for test500 page, Akamai will not have this page in cache, so request will forwarded to origin, origin will response with 500 response code, on receiving of 500 Akamai will believe that site is under stress or down and switch request to static site on Netstorage.

Hi Tuesday,

This is an issue with GDP (who serve the images) 

It's a know issue that we have previously reported this issue to both them and Wahome 

Not that it begin known makes it acceptable, simply that there is nothing we can do at this end, the images are served of a GDP mamaged server which it seems fails to serve images form time to time.

If you right-click and load the image (or the broken image) in a new window, you should see a url like this.
http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/venueImages/images/tn2/307807.jpg

locog-events.gdp-events.com is GDP server or more correctly an Amazon Cloud instance.

I think what is happening is that from time to time one of the AWS S3 servers is failing, it seems intermittent as GDP have more than one server serving images so sometimes you'll see the image and other times you won't. I think it also depends on your location as to what S3 server you will see.

The best thing to do is probably to right click the image and send GDP the broken image url (ie. http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/venueImages/images/tn2/307807.jpg) and the page you found it on. I think they are aware of the issue.

Jamie
Thanks Jamie.

Ticket #9106 "French website" was closed and merged into this ticket. Last comment in ticket #9106:

Thanks Anne,

- Do you have a url of a problem page
- When you create the page in News/French and publish it do you see the story on the new index page (in preview mode) / what does the page say does it just say "In progress" or "Published"?

I am wondering if what you are seeing is simply the index page not begin updated, normally the translation workflow causes the French news index and French home page to be republished, but if you create a page manually this won't happen and you'll have to re-publish those pages yourself.

Jamie

Hello Fiona, Anne, Mayra,

It appear that there were a couple of issues here.
First of all I am sorry that this has taken so long to get to the bottom of. I had naively assumed that this problem was directly related to the technical issues that the 3rd party servers were experiencing at the end of last week. However it was slightly more complicated than that.

Firstly, can you please use the "News article" template whenever you create news articles /anywhere/ on the website. I am not quite sure where the "News article fr" template came from but it should NOT be used. I am going to find out what it was used for and whether it can be deleted but ... until then (in fact, forever, going forward) can you use the "News article" template please?

Secondly, there was an issue (which I've only just discovered) whereby manually-created pages in the French site were not being assigned a language of "fr", meaning that - even though they were in the French site - they were not appearing on the various French hubs. This has now been fixed.

In short, if you create pages using the "News article" template, they should (now) get the correct language assigned to them and - when you publish them - they should appear on the site within a few minutes. I have not tested this all the way through (as I didn't want to place any test content on the live servers) but can you let me know (via this ticket) as soon as you try this, whether or not it works as expected.

Many thanks,

Kieran

Ticket #9024 "French website" was closed and merged into this ticket. Last comment in ticket #9024:

Kieran

By “first article” I meant the one called “Le site de mountain bike se prepare aux Jeux”. Its url is: http://www.london2012.com/fr/news/2012/04/le-site-de-mountain-bike-se-pr-pare-aux-jeux.php

The other one not appearing on the index is called “ Plus de 200 accords signés pour la reservation de ca,ps d’entraînement préolympiques au Royaume-Uni“ with its url:
http://www.london2012.com/fr/news/2012/04/plus-de-200-accords-sign-s-pour-la-r-servation-de-camps-.php
I just noticed there is a spelling mistake I can’t change in the title (we see “PLus” instead “Plus”) of this last article but only in the published version at this url.

Hope it helps!

Mayra

Hi,
Thanks for the reply.
The pages now appear on the news index, and the April 2012 index:
  http://www.london2012.com/fr/news/
  http://www.london2012.com/fr/news/2012/04/
I had to manually publish these two pages in order to get them to display the new article(s).
Our workflow processing presumes that all french pages are updated via the translation feed, and - as such - only automatically republishes the month and news hubs for articles that enter via the feed. I have looked into how tricky it might be to make this processing happen for ALL pages (including manually-created ones). My estimate is 1/2 day.
What sort of volume of pages are you looking to publish over the next few weeks?
If it is "just a few" then I would suggest that you manually publish:
  http://www.london2012.com/fr/news/
  http://www.london2012.com/fr/news/2012/04/
whenever you publish a new news article.
If it is "a lot" then it would probably be worth me amending the workflow processing.
Please let me know how you would like me to proceed (if at all?).
Thanks,
Kieran
PS I think you have fixed the "PLus vs Plus" issue yourself? Am I correct?

comments.value:
Hi all, Domenico in particular,

Where there is more than one community with a particular name, we told
them apart by looking at the first 4 significant figures of the
community latitude.
We then gave them our own name, as follows (in json format):

var disamb = {
    "Newport,50.70": "Newport, Isle of Wight",
    "Newport,52.78": "Newport, Shropshire",
    "Newport,51.59": "Newport, Gwent",
    "Newport,52.02": "Newport, Pembrokeshire",
    "Newport,51.98": "Newport, Essex",

    "Preston,53.77": "Preston, Lancashire",
    "Preston,50.65": "Preston, Dorset",

    "Hatfield,51.76": "Hatfield, Hertfordshire",
    "Hatfield,53.58": "Hatfield, Yorkshire",

    "Bangor,53.22": "Bangor, Gwynedd",
    "Bangor,54.65": "Bangor, County Down"
};

At one stage it LOOKED like there were also duplicate communities of
"Bristol" and "Plymouth". This turned out not to be the case - it was
just that they had incorrect latitude data.

Of course, we have always had the regions->communities lookup table
but unfortunately this was of little help, as the region data doesn't
appear in the Torchbearers export.

The London Boroughs' short names are looked up using the following
lookup (this time it's a php array! apologies - as you can see this
mapping has been refined in a very organic fashion!).

static $communityMap = array(
  "The City of London" => "City",
  "The City of Westminster" => "Westminster",
  "The London Borough of Barnet" => "Barnet",
  "The London Borough of Bexley" => "Bexley",
  "The London Borough of Brent" => "Brent",
  "The London Borough of Bromley" => "Bromley",
  "The London Borough of Camden" => "Camden",
  "The London Borough of Croydon" => "Croydon",
  "The London Borough of Ealing" => "Ealing",
  "The London Borough of Enfield" => "Enfield",
  "The London Borough of Hackney" => "Hackney",
  "The London Borough of Hammersmith & Fulham" => "Hammersmith & Fulham",
  "The London Borough of Haringey" => "Haringey",
  "The London Borough of Harrow" => "Harrow",
  "The London Borough of Havering" => "Havering",
  "The London Borough of Hillingdon" => "Hillingdon",
  "The London Borough of Hounslow" => "Hounslow",
  "The London Borough of Islington" => "Islington",
  "The London Borough of Lambeth" => "Lambeth",
  "The London Borough of Lewisham" => "Lewisham",
  "The London Borough of Merton" => "Merton Borough",
  "The London Borough of Newham" => "Newham",
  "The London Borough of Redbridge" => "Redbridge",
  "The London Borough of Richmond upon Thames" => "Richmond upon Thames",
  "The London Borough of Southwark" => "Southwark",
  "The London Borough of Sutton" => "Sutton",
  "The London Borough of Tower Hamlets" => "Tower Hamlets",
  "The London Borough of Waltham Forest" => "Waltham Forest",
  "The London Borough of Wandsworth" => "Wandsworth",
  "The Royal Borough of Greenwich" => "Greenwich",
  "The Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea" => "Kensington & Chelsea",
  "The Royal Borough of Kingston Upon Thames" => "Kingston"
);

I am happy to clarify anything that needs clarifying!

Kind regards,

Kieran

subject: Re: Torch Bearers and communities
latest_recipients: kieran@kitsite.com jamie@kitsite.com support@kitsite.com Andy.Watkins@london2012.com Domenico.Ventura@deltatre.com Kavita.Kapoor@london2012.com Liz.Goulding@london2012.com Tom.Price-Stephens@london2012.com
current_collaborators: Andy Watkins, Jamie Unwin, Kieran Topping, Tom Price Stephens
description:
Hi all, Domenico in particular,

Where there is more than one community with a particular name, we told
them apart by looking at the first 4 significant figures of the
community latitude.
We then gave them our own name, as follows (in json format):

var disamb = {
    "Newport,50.70": "Newport, Isle of Wight",
    "Newport,52.78": "Newport, Shropshire",
    "Newport,51.59": "Newport, Gwent",
    "Newport,52.02": "Newport, Pembrokeshire",
    "Newport,51.98": "Newport, Essex",

    "Preston,53.77": "Preston, Lancashire",
    "Preston,50.65": "Preston, Dorset",

    "Hatfield,51.76": "Hatfield, Hertfordshire",
    "Hatfield,53.58": "Hatfield, Yorkshire",

    "Bangor,53.22": "Bangor, Gwynedd",
    "Bangor,54.65": "Bangor, County Down"
};

At one stage it LOOKED like there were also duplicate communities of
"Bristol" and "Plymouth". This turned out not to be the case - it was
just that they had incorrect latitude data.

Of course, we have always had the regions->communities lookup table
but unfortunately this was of little help, as the region data doesn't
appear in the Torchbearers export.

The London Boroughs' short names are looked up using the following
lookup (this time it's a php array! apologies - as you can see this
mapping has been refined in a very organic fashion!).

static $communityMap = array(
  "The City of London" => "City",
  "The City of Westminster" => "Westminster",
  "The London Borough of Barnet" => "Barnet",
  "The London Borough of Bexley" => "Bexley",
  "The London Borough of Brent" => "Brent",
  "The London Borough of Bromley" => "Bromley",
  "The London Borough of Camden" => "Camden",
  "The London Borough of Croydon" => "Croydon",
  "The London Borough of Ealing" => "Ealing",
  "The London Borough of Enfield" => "Enfield",
  "The London Borough of Hackney" => "Hackney",
  "The London Borough of Hammersmith & Fulham" => "Hammersmith & Fulham",
  "The London Borough of Haringey" => "Haringey",
  "The London Borough of Harrow" => "Harrow",
  "The London Borough of Havering" => "Havering",
  "The London Borough of Hillingdon" => "Hillingdon",
  "The London Borough of Hounslow" => "Hounslow",
  "The London Borough of Islington" => "Islington",
  "The London Borough of Lambeth" => "Lambeth",
  "The London Borough of Lewisham" => "Lewisham",
  "The London Borough of Merton" => "Merton Borough",
  "The London Borough of Newham" => "Newham",
  "The London Borough of Redbridge" => "Redbridge",
  "The London Borough of Richmond upon Thames" => "Richmond upon Thames",
  "The London Borough of Southwark" => "Southwark",
  "The London Borough of Sutton" => "Sutton",
  "The London Borough of Tower Hamlets" => "Tower Hamlets",
  "The London Borough of Waltham Forest" => "Waltham Forest",
  "The London Borough of Wandsworth" => "Wandsworth",
  "The Royal Borough of Greenwich" => "Greenwich",
  "The Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea" => "Kensington & Chelsea",
  "The Royal Borough of Kingston Upon Thames" => "Kingston"
);

I am happy to clarify anything that needs clarifying!

Kind regards,

Kieran

Hi Anne,

When you say delay are you talking about a ~15min delay or a much longer delay ie. a day

If it's a ~15min delay is completely normal, as publication is set to run every 5 mins and then the pages need to sync across all the different front end servers, which can take another 5 to 10 mins.

But if your seeing a much longer delay could you explain your workflow, ie. the steps you are taking?

ps. last wee we did have an issue with publication, as Ia BT firewall chnage had blocked access from our CMS server to the live servers (so nothign was begin published), although that was resolved last week.

Jamie
Anne - how long is the delay? Is it just 10 minutes or so? Or longer?

Hi Jamie,
We have created the stories in the folder News/French. Should we only create them in News article without specifying French?
Thanks.
Anne

Thanks Anne,

- Do you have a url of a problem page
- When you create the page in News/French and publish it do you see the story on the new index page (in preview mode) / what does the page say does it just say "In progress" or "Published"?

I am wondering if what you are seeing is simply the index page not begin updated, normally the translation workflow causes the French news index and French home page to be republished, but if you create a page manually this won't happen and you'll have to re-publish those pages yourself.

Jamie
